sub_topic: Calculating the surface area of a cylinder.
message_1: What is the surface area of a cylinder with a radius of 5 cm and a height of 10 cm? Round your answer to the nearest square centimeter.
message_2:
The surface area of a cylinder can be calculated using the formula:

Surface Area = 2πr(h + r)

where r is the radius and h is the height of the cylinder.

In this case, r = 5 cm and h = 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Surface Area = 2π(5)(10 + 5)
Surface Area = 2π(5)(15)
Surface Area = 2π(75)
Surface Area ≈ 2(3.14)(75)
Surface Area ≈ 6.28(75)
Surface Area ≈ 471

So, the surface area of the cylinder is approximately 471 square centimeters, rounded to the nearest square centimeter.
